definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
fence/railing/hurdle/column or box (of text or other data)

sentences.english: Please see Prayer list on website or Church Bulletin.
sentences.chinese: 每周代祷事项请见网站或公布栏。

sentences.english: Don’t you ever look at the messages posted on the bulletin board?
sentences.chinese: 你也不看公布栏上贴的信息吗？

sentences.english: I saw your advertisement on one of the bulletin boards.
sentences.chinese: 我在某一个公布栏上看到你的广告。

sentences.english: Our teacher pinned a notice on the noticeboard.
sentences.chinese: 我们的老师把通知钉在公布栏上。

definition: to log out (computer)/to publish/to be published/to appear (in a newspaper etc)
announcement (written, on billboard, letter, newspaper or website)/to post information/a notice
to publish a roll-call of successful candidates
